--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Cheng" <wjcheng@...> wrote:
>
> Can you use junit to monitor stock? Someone told me that he used
> Junit to monitor a stock called BVSN and that alert him on the price
> up. Is it possible? Or is it just a joke? Any comment are
> appreciated, and if you know how to technically, I would like to hear.
>
> Cheng
>

OK, even though it makes no sense at all to use JUnit, I'll play along - just for fun.

Below is a quick'n'dirty JUnit test I put together in 5min (and during a meeting) to do what
you asked for. You can use it to "play along" with your friend's joke (as Cedric suggested).
It uses Google quotes to check on the price of BVSN every minute and fails with the
message "Stock has gone up. BUY! BUY!" if BVSN gets above $3.00.

All I ask is that any profit you make from the use of this program are shared 50/50 with
me. All losses are your responsibility. Reading of this message implies acceptance of
this agreement. :-)

Alberto

http://www.junitfactory.com
Free characterization tests
in JUnit.

---------



import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.URL;

import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class TestStockMon extends TestCase {

public void testAlertMeIfStockDropsTooMuch() throws Exception {
while (true) {
double quote = getStockQuoteFromGoogleFinance("BVSN");
assertTrue("Stock has gone up. BUY! BUY!", quote <= 3.00);
Thread.sleep(60000);
}
}

public static double getStockQuoteFromGoogleFinance(String symbol) throws
IOException {
URL quotePage = new URL("http://finance.google.com/finance?q=" + symbol);
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader
(quotePage.openStream()));
String str;
while ((str = in.readLine().trim()) != null) {
if (isSourceLineWithQuote(symbol, str)) {
return extractQuote(str);
}
}
throw new RuntimeException("Quote not found for symbol " + symbol);
}

private static boolean isSourceLineWithQuote(String symbol, String str) {
return str.startsWith("new_title = ") && str.indexOf(symbol) >= 0;
}

private static double extractQuote(String str) {
str = str.substring(str.indexOf(':') + 1, str.length() - 1).trim();
str = str.substring(0, str.indexOf(' '));
return Double.valueOf(str);
}
}
